data.event: In 2006, Georgetown and Quitman County voted to consolidate their governments, becoming the smallest such consolidated entity in the Lower 48 states.
The Tobanana Post Office was established on January 10, 1833.

event.title: September 21, 1836, the name of the town was changed

data.event: On September 21, 1836, the name of the town was changed to "Georgetown" after the historic neighborhood in Washington, D.C. Georgetown was designated in 1859 as the county seat of Quitman County and was laid out as a town by order of the Inferior Court.

On September 21, 1836, the name of the town was changed to "Georgetown" after the historic neighborhood in Washington, D.C. Georgetown was designated in 1859 as the county seat of Quitman County and was laid out as a town by order of the Inferior Court.

event.title: was incorporated by an act of the legislature on December 9, 1859

data.event: The town was incorporated by an act of the legislature on December 9, 1859.
Georgetown was destroyed by fire in 1903; every building except for the post office and three houses were destroyed.
